docs.lead_paragraph: The Treasurer of New Jersey, Richard C. Leone, yesterday warned that the state faced a fiscal crisis and that the gap between income and anticipated state expenditures could produce a budget deficit of as much as $638-million next year. Earlier estimates of the deficit's magnitude, made following the defeat of Governor Byrne's tax-reform program, ranged' from $300-million to $500-million.

headline.main: Metropolitan Briefs; Estimate on Jersey Deficit Increased

docs.abstract: Josephine Aiosa and Catherine Rathbone beaten with baseball bat and robbed on Nov 14 in garage of Forest Hills apt bldg (S)
